[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Project Management System (PMS) defines requirements for task assignments, scheduling, collaboration, resource allocation, and progress tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS enables users to create, assign, track, and manage projects efficiently while integrating with communication and productivity tools.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with communication platforms, file storage systems, and financial tracking tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides a web-based and mobile UI with dashboards, Gantt charts, and progress indicators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports cloud-based storage and integrates with IoT-enabled tracking devices for time logging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS integrates with third-party APIs for scheduling, notifications, and document collaboration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS supports secure communication through TLS encryption and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS optimizes storage for historical project data, task tracking, and resource utilization reports.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS automates task tracking, milestone notifications, and team collaboration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS supports multi-region time zones and multilingual collaboration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS connects with productivity suites, messaging platforms, and project financial management tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS provides project planning, task management, resource allocation, collaboration tools, and deadline tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS serves project managers, team leads, team members, and business executives.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires internet access for real-time project tracking and cloud-based storage.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS relies on third-party integrations for scheduling, document storage, and collaboration tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Task Assignment: Allocation of responsibilities to team members.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with scheduling tools, messaging applications, and file-sharing services.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow project managers to create and assign tasks with descriptions, deadlines, and priority levels (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide real-time project dashboards with progress tracking and milestone updates (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable team members to log time spent on tasks and update task statuses (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer a drag-and-drop interface for task reallocation and workflow automation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process updates and display real-time progress changes within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store project tasks, team assignments, and performance metrics.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with Agile and Scrum project management frameworks.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO/IEC 27001 for secure project data storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure data encryption, access control, and role-based permissions (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Task completion tracking, project milestone audits, and real-time status validation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and integration guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO/IEC 27001 compliance, Agile framework guidelines, and industry best practices.
